conclusion: Analyze the given v-t graph for both cars and use the braking process information to determine collision time.
Car A starts at 25 m/s, and Car B starts at 15 m/s.
Both cars brake at the same time, so their velocity decreases linearly over time.
The graph shows both cars are moving downward, indicating they are slowing down.
Calculate the time taken for Car A to reach a velocity of 0, which is 20 seconds.
Calculate the time taken for Car B to reach a velocity of 0, which is 25 seconds.
Since both cars start braking simultaneously, the time at which the cars collide is the same as the time it takes for Car B to reach 0 m/s, which is 25 seconds.
Since the cars collide at the same time they start braking, the time at which they collide is after 20 seconds.
